Ask HN: How to respond to compensation request to reveal security vulnerability
text:
You're a small startup and someone claiming to be a bug bounty hunter cold reaches out to you to say they've discovered a critical security vulnerability on your website.

They want to know if you have a bug bounty program and what type of reward they'll receive if they disclose it to you.

Being a small startup, you don't have any formal program and cash is tight, but you want to take the report seriously if there is some critical vulnerability in your application.

What's the right way to respond to this type of reach out?

title: Ask HN: Are there senior positions where you get to focus purely on programming?
text:
Senior Engineers usually have many duties like hiring, mentoring, discussing the product and communicating with clients. Once that is done, you might get to do some programming.

Are there companies and positions where you get to focus almost fully on programming and mentoring? I assume I'd need to specialize in low-level stuff, where programming expertise is more highly valued and where the product roadmap is less important?

I got into programming because I like programming. Not a fan of all the other stuff.

Show HN: Pier – New VM Platform and Programming Language
text:
Hey folks,

This is a large hobby project I've been working on to create a new VM platform called Pier. The platform spec is currently private but the code for the compiler and VM is published on my GitHub. Most of my effort over the years has gone towards designing the Pier bytecode and working on the VM, so the language is rather limited right now.

Many features that would typically require you to choose specific APIs like GL/Vulkan/D3D are defined as custom APIs provided natively by Pier bytecode - the platform effectively provides an abstraction layer that allows the VM to be implemented on top of various different APIs. I took this further by defining a custom shader bytecode IR format, which gets translated to a shading language (like GLSL) by the VM. Currently Pier is limited to Linux, but I intend to port the VM to Windows soon which should be a trivial task.

Let me know what you think!
